The first set of English madrigalls to 4. 5. & 6. voyces. Made and newly published by George Kirbye. Madrigals Kirbye, George, ca. 1565-1634.
[138] p. : music
Printed by Thomas Este dwelling in aldersgate street, London : 1597.
Six partbooks. At head of title, part 1: "Cantus. Prim[us]."; part 2: "Cantus. Secund[us]."; part 3: "Altus."; part 4: "Tenor."; part 5: "Bassus."; part 6: "Sextus.". Signatures: [A]² B-D⁴; [A]² B-D⁴; [A]² B⁴ C² ; [A]² B-D⁴; [A]² B-D⁴; [A]² B⁴ (-B4). Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery. Lacking Altus.
=======
The first set of English madrigalls to 4. 5. & 6. voyces. Made and newly published by George Kirbye. Madrigals Kirbye, George, ca. 1565-1634.
[138] p. : music
Printed by Thomas Este dwelling in aldersgate street, London : 1597.
Six partbooks. At head of title, part 1: "Cantus. Prim[us]."; part 2: "Cantus. Secund[us]."; part 3: "Altus."; part 4: "Tenor."; part 5: "Bassus."; part 6: "Sextus.". Signatures: [A]² B-D⁴; [A]² B-D⁴; [A]² B⁴ C² ; [A]² B-D⁴; [A]² B-D⁴; [A]² B⁴ (-B4). Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery. Lacking Altus.
Thomas Este
aldersgate street
